ads.author: Donald Hopkins
ads.title: AC DC Luci Pinball Game - Limited Edition
ads.description:
I bought this from a friend on 3/7/21. An original Luci was on my list for a long time. The vault Luci has the gawd awful ugly black band around the lower playfield with all the screws holding it in. The original is the Luci to have if you can find one.

Many tasteful mods including chrome stage cover, cannon, "Luci bell", lit train, color DMD, flipper fidelity speakers, lit topper, shaker motor, LEDs and more. See pics.

This game has the jukebox mode. You hold both flippers while in attract mode and an old school radio comes up on the DMD. You press the flipper buttons L or R to tune the "station" and play all the songs in the game. With the upgraded speakers, it sounds amazing!

ads.author: Ethan Perdue
ads.title: Theatre of Magic Pinball Machine- Lots of Brass
ads.description:
For Sale: Theatre of Magic pinball machine. Asking $7900. Lots of brass. Most affordable on the internet. Located in Auburn, AL.

Was in the tournament area at SFGE. It is a very reliable machine. I have replaced the trunk, decals, and glass within the last year. Playfield looks good. Plastics look good. Full LED. Recent rubber kit. Cliffys installed at the trunk and basement. 

The bad: 

Four of the lights on the Mirror mod are not working. I have not investigated the issue.

There is a decal cover on the playfield at the drain (pictured). I do not know what is under it. I\u2019m not going to find out what is under it. 

There is some wear on the lockbar from use (pictured). 

The left side on the backbox has a touched up area. I owned this for about 2 years before I noticed it (pictured).

It is a great machine. It is my most reliable pin. I am asking $7900 cash on the glass. I will not ship it. If you want it shipped, have your shipper show up with $7900, and my responsibility ends when I see tail lights. I would prefer to see this go to someone that wants this pin and not someone trying to flip it. 

Trades I will consider:

1) The Getaway. I want one with a good original playfield. I don\u2019t mind a little dirt, but I don\u2019t want diamond bubbles around inserts. Obviously cash my way as well. 

2) Fire Champagne Edition, preferably is as rough as possible but complete. Obviously with cash my way as well.

3) Fathom, also preferred to be rough but complete with cash my way. 

I\u2019m having space issues, so I\u2019m not interested in taking multiples. I would prefer a cash deal. If you have any questions please ask.

ads.author: Craig Shaw
ads.title: Stern PINBALL pinball machine
ads.description:
"PINBALL" pinball machine by Stern. 1977 full solid state pinball machine. This machine has been redone and refurbished in many ways.  
First off...
This machine has the new Alltec ultimate universal mpu/cpu replacement board. This Alltek board can be used for Stern and Bally machines as a replacement. This one is set to this machine, "PINBALL" by Stern. 
next..
This machine has a brand new solenoid driver board by ROTTENDOG AMUSEMENTS BPS022 made for Stern machines. 
This machine has a brand new rectifier board ( fuse board )
The LDA board was purchased in 2021 as a refurbished board as well. 
All pins and connectors are new. Every pin and connector to every board are new! You can see this  in the pics. 
This was a covid project. I re-pinned every connection, It was many hundreds of connections, all brand new. 
This machine will last 50 years just like the 50 years it is old. 
This machine, PINBALL, by stern is actually a really fun pinball, it has skilled bonus shots and strategy to make the high score.
The Play field on this unit is 95\u0025 correct, I cant remember but I think one thing is not working correctly. I cannot remember as the machine plays out great. As you can see I have the the high score of 985990, its higher than any I have seen on pinside website!  
The box is clean and fresh paint on most of it. The coin op works on one side. It has been currently charging .50 for 3 plays. Still makes money all the time!

I love this machine, its my first pinball machine, I would not be selling it unless I needed the money for my family here at christmas, so thank you.

ads.author: Max Johnson
ads.title: WANTED: FIRE! pinball machine
ads.description: I am re-starting a program where I place a FIRE! pinball machine in a fire station on $.50 per play.  At the end of the month, I count the quarters, match the amount, and then donate it to the charity of the stations choice.  The game gives the guys something to do when they arent working, and the proceeds help others.  I did this many years ago and it was a very successful event.  I rotate the game into another fire station every 60 days.  I need two or three more machines (FIRE!) due to the sheer number of fire stations there are.  I cant pay top dollar because this is for non profit.  I restore each of these games before they are placed so that they look good and are less likely to fail.  I of course pay for all the repairs.  There is NO cost to the firefighters, other than paying fifty cents (or donating $.50) to a charity.   If you know of anyone who has a FIRE! pinball and would like it to go to a very good cause, let me know.

ads.author: Jessica Wetzel
ads.title: Arcade Machine with over 1000 games!
ads.description:
I've got a vintage Xevious arcade cabinet that I converted to a digital gaming machine. I replaced the old CRT monitor with a new 21" flat screen and replaced the old board inside with a Windows desktop. It runs an image called Arcadia that has 1,071 games on it. Even just sitting there, it runs in what is called an "attract mode" where it cycles through the games randomly and shows gameplay from the selected game and then switches every 10 seconds or so. Just turning it on is like being in a busy arcade!

Originally, this cabinet had only one control stick and 2 buttons but I upgraded it into a two player machine, adding another control stick and 6 buttons per person! This makes it perfect for playing fighting games and really anything you can imagine. I even used the old arcade buttons to enable scrolling through the plethora of games easier (One goes Up the alphabet one letter and the other goes Down). This is all facilitated by an arcade-to-USB adapter.

I have played dozens of the games on here but not all of them and some of them do require mapping the buttons so it also comes with a wireless keyboard/mouse combo to make that easier. As such, I recommend being technically inclined in order to ensure a smooth playing experience all around.

Obviously, this thing is heavy but it has it's own wheels built in so it's basically a dolly on it's own. The buyer will have to provide their own method of transportation (a trailer would be best but it might fit in a truck bed) - I'm in Milton off Glover Lane.

Let me know if you have any questions or want to check if a certain game is on there.

Pickup in Milton

ads.author: S\u00e9amus McDermott
ads.title: Super Rectrocade with over 90 games!
ads.description:
The Super Retro-Cade offers a cost effective way to play big name games including arcade versions of Final Fight, Bionic Commando, Double Dragon, Mr. Heli, Strider, R-Type and Ghouls n' Ghosts, plus numerous NES and SNES games. This little white box is in fact a secret weapon, an emulation Swiss army knife that can handle roms from pretty much any cartridge-based system of the '80s and '90s. This makes the Super Retro-Cade a particularly appealing proposition for retro gamers who might have existing 8-bit and 16-bit games collections - and want to give their creaking hardware a break.

It will comfortably run roms for Nintendo systems, the NES, SNES and Gameboy (including the Colour and Advance); Sega's Master System and Mega Drive/Genesis; and the less well-known Turbografx-16 (aka the PC Engine to UK gamers). Adding new games is as simple as loading roms onto a Micro SD card and adding the corresponding .png artwork file.

ads.title: Modded Street Fighter Arcade1up arcade machine with a Dell Micro PC
ads.description:
Up for sale is a modded Arcade1up Street Fighter cabinet with an Intel Core i5 7th Gen PC. It currently has about 800 fighting games installed plus another 80 or so arcade games. It\u2019s running Batocera version 41 on it.

There are a few things that still need to be done. First, only player one is connected. You would need to get a $10 Zero Delay USB encoder for player two. Second, it\u2019s only playing out of the PCs speaker at the moment. An external amp would be needed to utilize the cabinets built in speaker or you could buy a 2.1 speaker system to make this thing rock. 

Instead of putting more money into the build, I\u2019m deciding to sell it as is. I could finish it quickly but the price would be higher. If it comes down to that, I will just finish it and sell it but I\u2019m giving modders the opportunity to finish it they way they want to. 

Feel free to message me for more info.
